segments.text: I notice the water just pouring over the sink, and it’s making me so angry.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t noticed the puddle at her feet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are up to no good, and she’s completely clueless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s going to regret not paying attention when someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is about to fall, and she won’t even notice until it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s ever going to turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just a disaster waiting to happen, and she’s doing nothing about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t watch this anymore; it’s making me too frustrated.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone needs to step in before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR
